body:
this could work:

```
 if (CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P EQUAL 8) # 64 bit
    Set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} -fPIC")
 endif()
```

That adds the -fPIC option on 64-bit. It is the opposite of what we want. We want to remove it when we're 32-bit and not building a shared library. I don't have access to enough test platforms to make this change myself without risking breaking things.
the opposite would be to add it on 32 bit, wtf?

code wise opposite:

```
if (NOT CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P EQUAL 8) # 32 bit
    Set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} -fPIC")
endif()
```
Let me clarify: -fPIC is currently added. Even when not necessary. I would like it removed.

replace this line:
https://github.com/assimp/assimp/blob/master/CMakeLists.txt#L66

with the code i suggested. then you are pretty close to what you want.

No, that won't do. We want (need in fact) -fPIC when building SHARED libraries but not when building STATIC libraries.

Also there's an "else" with some msvc options. I don't have msvc so I can't test my modifications won't break it.

then

```
if (NOT CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P EQUAL 8 AND BUILD_SHARED_LIBS)
   Set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} -fPIC")
endif()
```

also you didn't understand what i wrote. line 66 is

```
set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} -fPIC") 
```

this line must be replaced, nothing else.

Hmm, almost but not quite. We don't want to check pointer size since when we need -fPIC we need it on both, just on 64-bit it's not quite the performance disaster it's on 32. I'll try that and send a pull request. Will you test it on msvc and mingw?

Also anyone know what os x wants and how this works in there?
Looks like you beat me to it.

https://github.com/assimp/assimp/pull/651

-fPIC isn't needed on 32 bit afaik.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17900463/create-so-files-on-linux-without-using-pic-position-independent-code-x86-32b

Not "required" in that it will work without -fPIC but your memory usage and loading time will go way up. Probably best not merge that.

this makes me think the addition of fPIC should be configureable:

compiling 32bit with fPIC makes the code runs at most 5-10% slower according to the answer there.

At least the [Debian policy manual](https://www.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/ch-files.html#fr84) states that -fPIC must be the default everywhere unless there's a very good and documented reason for it. If you want to make it configurable then it should default to on.

> While this is not strictly incorrect it is inefficient since among other things it wastes one register on 32-bit x86 which really doesn't have any to spare.

vs. 

> At least the Debian policy manual states that -fPIC must be the default everywhere unless there's a very good and documented reason for it. If you want to make it configurable then it should default to on.

and the next response is, that -fPIC must not be used on 32 bit because of policy rule #23 of fedora?

what do you finally suggest?

imo it should be configureable (which it is with my change). it only adds -fPIC when really needed.

when you always want -fPIC, add it to the cmake options with

```
cmake -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS=-fPIC
```
Do you have a link to the fedora policy?
